intro: Serratula lasiocephala, commonly known as the woollyhead groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Serratula lasiocephala typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine environments. It is a perennial species that thrives in cooler climates and is relatively drought-tolerant.
